div1.p: United States Consulate St. Paul de Loanda S.W.G. Africa June 30
L. de R. du Verge to Dept of State Washington D.C.
Subject Acting governor and receipt of Circulars and unoffical.
United States Consulate St Paul de Loanda June 30th 1882.
The Hon. J.C. Bancroft Davis Asst. Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir Since the death of General Dantas govt. genl. of Angola and the provinces, Joseph, Lord Bishop of Angola, has been the acting govenor and President of the Council composed of four; Two british gun boat and a corvette left here for the Cape of good Hope, St Helenam and St. America-- The Irish Earl of mayo with two others, left for mossamedes and "Huïlla" the new "Boër" settlement in the Portuguese possession of the Sonoh West Coast of Africa. On a exposed shooting and brutishh geographical expedition; We have no in Port, one two corvettes and a portugese gun boat the latter will leave for the Congo on the 5th of July. The city of Loanda is for the presnt in a very sickly state, and the billions fern now exciting is very dangerous for Europeans who have resided her for a few years, The
change of air further North or South is highly recommanded by the principal physicians of this place. The living in St Paul de Loanda is very high, and a man; particylarly a consul here with only $1000. a year, can only prevent himself from starving, as the agency attached to this consulate and mention by Mr. Swellon A. Brown does not exist any more.

Kerosene oil, American lumber of all sorts, Naval stores, Lard, Butter; can stores, Hams Bacon, salted beef and Pork in half Bands cheap Furniture, goods flour in half bands now in great demand; I believe that a vessel of 200 to 250 tons with the above mentioned articles would sealy; a very good profit and find a return cargo.

The Portugese have in custody a man named J. B. Silveira citzen born in the U.S. and who was once U.S. Consul at Lisbon, as soon as I will be able to find out more about him and his case will notify your Depart. In Loanda there is two Americans trades Wm Parks and Marsins, the latter a Sea Capt. who lost
his vessel at that place under very suspicious circumstances, I am told that in " Labinda Benguela, Mossamedes and few othes small places on the coast a few americans are now trading, and that great many americans Whalers call at thoses places for provisions ga and in many instances, the crew are put on shore if they do no suit, or in most cases run away from their vessel for ill treatment, the consequences are; that they generally come upon this consulate for support as destitute steamer.

I would respectfully suggest that I may be authorized to appoint Consular agenets all over the coast from Gaboon, as far as Great Fish Bay, beside the Islands of Ternandoro, Princess, ST Thome; Annaboa. I have also applied to the Medical and other authorities to give me if possible a weekly return of sickness and deseases existing, beside the list of import and export to this port, also to gentlemen in Benguela Mossamedes, Bengo, Ambriz and other ports for a plain statement of their
their Coffee, Cocoa, Sugar, Rum and Cotton factories.

If the State Departent would allow me to call at those places once and while, I believe that I would be able to give you and your Depart. a full and correct statement of every doing of interest and valuable to the United States Government and its different Departments beside promoting ito commerce
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient servant L. de R. de Verge U.S. Consul
